pageContent: Background: Robot-assisted radical prostatectomy (RARP) is a rising minimally invasive treatment of localized prostate cancer (PC). We present our multicenter experience of 1,499 consecutive cases with an analysis of complication rates, oncologic, and functional outcomes.

metaData.source:
Latent variable modelling of recovery trajectories: sexual function following radical prostatectomy
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15344192/
